message: I'm excited to offer you this amazing product, and I think we can come to a mutually beneficial agreement. I'm willing to sell it to you for $12,000. This is a great deal, and I'm confident you'll love it!
Alice, thanks for the offer.  That price is a little high for me. I'd be willing to pay $9,000 for the product.

I understand you're looking to save some money, but I still need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering $11,000. This is the lowest I can go, and I'm confident you'll see the value in the product.
Alice, I appreciate you meeting me halfway.  How about we split the difference again and settle at $10,000?

I'm glad we're getting closer to a deal, but I still need to make a decent profit. I'm willing to make one more concession, so I'm counteroffering $11,500. This is as low as I can go, and I think it's still a great value for you.
Alice, it seems like we're getting bogged down.  I'm willing to make this my final offer: $10,250.  This is a fair price and I need to get moving if we can't agree.
I understand you need to move forward, but I'm not willing to give up on this deal yet. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $10,625. This is the lowest I can go and still make a profit.
